remarks: First-order logic and set theory.  (Contributed by Jonathan Ben-Naim, 3-Jun-2011.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
bnj563.19 $e |- ( et <-> ( m e. D /\ n = suc m /\ p e. _om /\ m = suc p ) ) $.
bnj563.21 $e |- ( rh <-> ( i e. _om /\ suc i e. n /\ m =/= suc i ) ) $.
bnj563 $p |- ( ( et /\ rh ) -> suc i e. m ) $.
